document_notes.text:
This update for libass fixes the following issues:

CVE-2016-7969, CVE-2016-7970, CVE-2016-7971, CVE-2016-7972: Fixed multiple memory allocation issues found by fuzzing (bsc#1002982).
document_notes.title: Details

notes.text: The wrap_lines_smart function in ass_render.c in libass before 0.13.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read) via unspecified vectors, related to "0/3 line wrapping equalization."
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

notes.text: Buffer overflow in the calc_coeff function in libass/ass_blur.c in libass before 0.13.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via unspecified vectors.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

notes.text: ** REJECT **  DO NOT USE THIS CANDIDATE NUMBER. ConsultIDs: none. Reason: This candidate was withdrawn by its CNA. Further investigation showed that it was not a security issue. Notes: none.

notes.text: The check_allocations function in libass/ass_shaper.c in libass before 0.13.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory allocation failure) via unspecified vectors.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description
